alert.note: Alert for Clearfield (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:16PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CLEARFIELD COUNTY THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 316 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over DuBois, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... DuBois, Sandy, Penfield, Parker Dam State Park, Falls Creek, Treasure Lake and Penn State Dubois. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and north central Pennsylvania.
